intro: Stigmaphyllon urenifolium, commonly known as the yellow stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its hairy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in subtropical gardens.
